prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 1
Name: Florence Niedler
Description: A nurse who works at Hertz Hospital. Has a worrying tendency to offer unnecessary treatments to everyone she meets.
Character 2
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A mysterious young woman brought to the High Prosecutors' Offices by Florence Niedler. She appears to have lost her memory, but...
Character 3
Name: Hilda Hertz
Description: The head of Hertz Hospital. Carried out the preliminary inspection of the victim in this case.
Character 4
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. She is a highly talented prosecutor, and is currently working with Interpol.
Character 5
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: The greatest prosecutor ever to prosecute... according to himself, anyway. In actual fact, his relationship with logic is tenuous at best.
Character 6
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 7
Name: Rosie Ringer
Description: The victim in this case. She was a defense attorney, and served on the Committee alongside Judge Gavèlle.
Character 8
Name: Excelsius Winner
Description: Former chief prosecutor, current Chairman of the Committee, and Eustace Winner's father. Has a tendency to burst into tears over nothing.
Character 9
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: Senior partner at Edgeworth and Co. He's trying to get me to become a defense attorney.
Character 10
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A high school student looking to become a forensic investigator, and the younger sister of my former boss.
Character 11
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: A freelance photojournalist who I've met in the past. Known for her ability to sniff out scoops and snap them with her trusty camera.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Yatagarasu Pin
Description: The Yatagarasu pin that Kay always wears.
Evidence 2
Name: Jammin' Ninja Mask
Description: A mask modeled on the Jammin' Ninja's face. Made of cheap plastic.
Evidence 3
Name: Letter
Description: A letter Kay was carrying. It is addressed to her.
Evidence 4
Name: Promise Notebook
Description: A book of promises Kay made to her father when she was a little girl. What was it doing in the Committee chamber?
Evidence 5
Name: Ticket Stub
Description: Stub from a ticket granting entry to the viewing platform on top of the Bigg Building.
Evidence 6
Name: Magenta Flower
Description: A magenta flower made of fabric that is usually worn on the chest as a decoration. Also known as a corsage. A magenta flower made of fabric that is usually worn on the chest as a decoration. Torn from the victim's clothes.
Evidence 7
Name: Bigg Building Pamphlet
Description: Contains a cross-section of the building and a plan of the viewing platform. [caption] On the roof is the viewing platform. Beneath is a storeroom on the 51th floor, and the P.I.C meeting room on the 50th floor. On a top-down view of the viewing platform on the roof, to the left-most edge is a cherry tree. To the right-most edge is a candy stand.
Evidence 8
Name: Kay's Recollections
Description: Kay remembers a person coming from beyond the concession stand and pushing her off of the building.
Evidence 9
Name: Candelabrum
Description: A three-armed candle holder that may have been the murder weapon, judging by the wounds to the the victim's chest. A three-armed candle holder found by the victim's body. Made to look like the murder weapon.
Evidence 10
Name: Keycard
Description: A keycard that grants entry to the Committee chamber. Found in the victim's hand.
Evidence 11
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Initial findings of Dr. Hilda Hertz. Cause of death: Stab wounds to left chest. Head injury sustained post mortem. Death occurred as a result of a heavy blow to the head with a circular object. Chest wounds inflicted post-mortem.
Evidence 12
Name: Keycard Record
Description: Record of keycards used to enter the Committee chamber.
Evidence 13
Name: Victim's Letter
Description: A letter that appears to have been written to the victim by Kay.
Evidence 14
Name: Broken Plushie
Description: The stuffed animal we originally found in the Zheng Fa presidential plane. Missing its left horn. Fitted with a recording device that captured part of a conversation. One of the people recorded had a prominent burn.
Evidence 15
Name: Masks
Description: A selection of various masks was kept on a rack. Each participant in the auction wore one.
Evidence 16
Name: Ringleader's Appearance
Description: Ringleader wore a white jacket, white gloves, a magenta flower, and a mask. Age and gender could not be discerned. Ringleader wore a white jacket, white gloves, a magenta flower, and a mask. Also had a tattoo on the part of their face the mask didn't cover.
Evidence 17
Name: Ms. Hart's Picture
Description: A photograph of the mysterious figure in the red raincoat. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Ms. Hart's Statement
Description: Ms. Hart's observations about what happened during the mysterious auction.
Evidence 19
Name: Elevator Blood
Description: Blood was detected on the secret elevator. It looks like it dripped through to the floor below.
Evidence 20
Name: Clothes Box
Description: Box in which the killer hid the body. Traces of blood were detected inside.
Evidence 21
Name: Committee Chamber Blood
Description: Blood found in the Committee chamber. Was it placed there to hide the existence of the storeroom?
Evidence 22
Name: Red Raincoat
Description: Worn by the victim, whose fingerprints and blood were found on the hood.
Evidence 23
Name: Nurse Niedler's Statement
Description: Niedler's description of how she swapped places with Rosie Ringer.
Evidence 24
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Details of a murder case from eighteen years ago.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Did I... really come to a place like this?
Person: Kay
Testimony 1
Testimony: It's so high up, and the wind is so strong... It's frightening.
Person: Kay
Testimony 2
Testimony: ...I just can't remember. I can't remember anything at all...
Person: Kay
Testimony 3
Testimony: But... from under the cherry tree... I feel like... I saw something red.
Person: Kay
Testimony 4
Testimony: Umm... That's right, someone was walking towards me from the other side of that stand.
Person: Kay
Testimony 5
Testimony: .....I'm sorry. Just as I thought, it's impossible.
Person: Kay

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's break it down step by step.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. There's Kay Faraday, who's a mysterious woman with amnesia. She was found by Florence Niedler, a nurse, and is currently at Hertz Hospital. The victim is Rosie Ringer, a defense attorney, and the case involves some kind of murder or accident at the Bigg Building.

Looking at the evidences, there's a lot here. Evidence 6 is a magenta flower corsage that was torn from the victim's clothes. Evidence 8 is Kay's recollection of someone pushing her off the building from beyond a concession stand. Evidence 9 is a candelabrum that might have been the murder weapon, but it's noted that the chest wounds were inflicted post-mortem, which is odd because if the victim was pushed off, the head injury would likely be the cause of death, not the chest wounds.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Kay's statements are crucial. In testimony 4, she mentions seeing someone walking towards her from beyond a concession stand. That aligns with her recollection of being pushed off. But wait, the autopsy report (evidence 11) says the cause of death was a heavy blow to the head, and the chest wounds were post-mortem. So if Kay was pushed off, the head injury would be the result of the fall, but the chest wounds were inflicted after death, which suggests the candelabrum might not be the murder weapon but something else.

But the contradiction comes when considering the candelabrum as the murder weapon. If the chest wounds were post-mortem, then the candelabrum couldn't have caused the death. Therefore, evidence 9 (candelabrum) contradicts the testimony 4 (Kay's recollection of being pushed) because the candelabrum wasn't used to kill her; it was used after she died.

So, the pair is evidence 9 and testimony 4.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I've got a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The goal is to identify one pair that doesn't align and then present the answer in a specific JSON format.

First, I'll start by carefully reading through all the provided information to understand the context of the case. It seems like there's been a murder, and various pieces of evidence and testimonies are being presented to determine the culprit. My job is to find a contradiction between one piece of evidence and one testimony.

Looking at the characters, I see several key individuals involved in the investigation, including detectives, prosecutors, and the victim. The evidences range from physical items like the victim's body, keys, and weapons, to more abstract pieces like autopsy reports and security footage. The testimonies are statements made by various individuals involved in the case.

I'll go through each evidence and compare it against each testimony to see if any contradictions arise. It's important to pay attention to details that might seem inconsistent or impossible based on the information provided.

For example, let's consider the evidence about the victim's body and the testimony about the time of death. If the autopsy report suggests the victim died between certain hours, but a testimony claims they saw the victim alive after that time, that would be a contradiction.

Another point to consider is the presence of certain items at the crime scene. If a testimony mentions the use of a specific weapon, but the evidence shows that the weapon wasn't present or couldn't have been used in the way described, that's another potential contradiction.

I'll need to be meticulous in cross-referencing each piece of evidence with each testimony to ensure I don't miss any subtle contradictions. It's also crucial to understand the context of each piece of evidence and testimony to accurately assess their compatibility.

After carefully reviewing all the information, I'll identify the pair that contradicts each other and format the answer as specified.
</think>

cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by understanding the problem. I have a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. I need to find one pair where an evidence and a testimony contradict each other.

First, I'll go through the testimonies to see what each person is saying. The testimonies are given by Gravelle, and they talk about the relationship between Kay Faraday and Ms. Crane, the victim. Gravelle mentions that they had a partnership that broke down, and that Ms. Crane was murdered but managed to retaliate by leaving a letter in her breast pocket.

Now, looking at the evidence, I need to find something that contradicts this. Let's go through the evidence one by one. Evidence 13 is a letter that appears to have been written by Kay to the victim. Gravelle's testimony says that the victim left the letter in her breast pocket as a parting gift, implying she wrote it before her death. But evidence 13 says the letter was written by Kay, not the victim. This seems contradictory because if the victim wrote the letter, it should be her words, but the evidence says Kay wrote it.

So, the contradiction is between Evidence 13 and Testimony 4. Gravelle says the letter was from the victim, but the evidence says it was from Kay. That's the pair I need to highlight.
</think>
